doc.ContractDescription: YDP AIR COMPRESSOR PARTS

ONE OF THE MOST IMPORTANT PROPERTIES OF MESOSCALE EDDIES IS THEIR ABILITY TO TRANSPORT SUCH DYNAMICALLY AND CLIMATICALLY IMPORTANT OCEANIC TRACERS, AS HEAT, SALT AND CARBON. RECENT STUDIES SUGGEST THAT THIS EDDY INDUCED TRANSPORT HAS COMPLEX NON-UNIFORM SPATIAL STRUCTURE AND IS OFTEN HIGHLY ANISOTROPIC. THE EDDY-INDUCED TRACER TRANSPORT IS PARAMETERIZED BY EDDY DIFFUSIVITY IN NON-EDDYRESOLVING CLIMATE MODELS, BUT THESE PARAMETERIZATIONS ARE OFTEN PURELY EMPIRICAL AND DO NOT ACCOUNT FOR THE OBSERVED COMPLEXITY OF THE EDDY FIELD. ON THE OTHER HAND, EMERGING HIGH RESOLUTION MODELS PARTLY RESOLVE THE MESOSCALE, BUT THE ACCURACY OF THEIR SIMULATION OF THE MOST IMPORTANT EDDY TRANSPORT PROPERTIES REQUIRES VERIFICATION. RELIABLE ESTIMATES OF THE EDDY INDUCED TRANSPORT ARE URGENTLY NEEDED FOR ADVANCING OUR UNDERSTANDING OF OCEAN AND CLIMATE DYNAMICS. SATELLITE ALTIMETRY BOTH THE CURRENT AND FUTURE SWOT MISSIONS PROVIDES THE SCIENTIFIC COMMUNITY WITH THE NEARLY GLOBAL NEARSURFACE GEOSTROPHIC VELOCITY ESTIMATES. USING SYNTHETIC LAGRANGIAN PARTICLE TRAJECTORIES, SIMULATED USING THESE ALTIMETRIC VELOCITIES, ONE CAN READILY DERIVE EDDY DIFFUSIVITIES. HOWEVER, THE RELIABILITY AND INTERPRETATION OF THE RESULTING EDDY DIFFUSIVITIES PRESENTS A CHALLENGE BECAUSE OF THE LIMITED SPATIO TEMPORAL RESOLUTION, THE NON UNIFORM SPATIAL COVERAGE, AND THE ABSENCE OF NON-GEOSTROPHIC VELOCITY COMPONENTS IN ALTIMETRY DERIVED CURRENTS. WE PROPOSE TO UNDERTAKE A MULTI YEAR STUDY OF THE GLOBAL EDDY INDUCED MATERIAL TRANSPORT WITH AN EMPHASIS ON PRODUCING THE MOST RELIABLE ALTIMETRY BASED DIFFUSIVITY ESTIMATES ALONG WITH THE CORRESPONDING MAPS OF THE LOCATION DEPENDENT UNCERTAINTY IN THESE ESTIMATES AND SPECIFIC RECOMMENDATIONS ON THE OPTIMAL USE OF RAW ALONG-TRACK DATA FOR THESE ESTIMATES. WE WILL EXTEND OUR PREVIOUS STUDY IN THE NORTH ATLANTIC TO THE GLOBAL DOMAIN AND COMBINE IT WITH A SUITE OF CAREFULLY DESIGNED OBSERVING SYSTEM SIMULATION EXPERIMENTS OSSES. OUR OBJECTIVES ARE TO, 1, EXAMINE THE SENSITIVITY AND ACCURACY OF THE ALTIMETRY BASED EDDY DIFFUSIVITY ESTIMATES TO THE SPATIO TEMPORAL RESOLUTION OF THE UNDERLYING SSH FIELDS, 2, COME UP WITH RECOMMENDATIONS FOR THE OPTIMAL PROCESSING APPROACH FOR THE ALONGTRACK SSH MEASUREMENTS THAT YIELDS THE MOST RELIABLE ESTIMATES OF THE EDDY DIFFUSIVITIES, AND 3, SYSTEMATICALLY DESCRIBE THE GLOBAL DISTRIBUTION OF THE EDDY DIFFUSIVITIES ALONG WITH THEIR UNCERTAINTY LEVELS, SPATIAL INHOMOGENEITIES, ANISOTROPIC PROPERTIES, DEPENDENCE ON LARGE-SCALE PARAMETERS, AND IMPORTANCE OF MOTIONS NOT RESOLVED BY ALTIMETRY. THIS STUDY DIRECTLY ADDRESSES ONE OF THE RESEARCH THEMES IN THE PHYSICAL OCEANOGRAPHY PROGRAM BY CONTRIBUTING TO THE INTERPRETATION OF THE OCEAN MESOSCALE CIRCULATION USING SATELLITE DATA. THE RESULTS ARE EXPECTED TO ADVANCE OUR UNDERSTANDING OF THE SIGNIFICANCE OF EDDY TRANSPORT OF SUCH CLIMATICALLY IMPORTANT QUANTITIES AS HEAT AND CARBON AND ARE, THEREFORE, HIGHLY RELEVANT TO THE U.S. CLIVAR OBJECTIVE TO, TO DESCRIBE AND UNDERSTAND THE PHYSICAL PROCESSES RESPONSIBLE FOR CLIMATE VARIABILITY AND PREDICTABILITY, THROUGH THE COLLECTION AND ANALYSIS OF OBSERVATIONS. THE RESULTS WILL ALSO HAVE IMPORTANT IMPLICATIONS FOR VALIDATION AND FURTHER DEVELOPMENT OF CLIMATE MODELS THAT EITHER PARAMETERIZE OR PARTIALLY RESOLVE MESOSCALE EDDIES, IN DIRECT RELEVANCE TO ANOTHER CLIVAR OBJECTIVE TO, TO EXTEND THE RANGE AND ACCURACY OF SEASONAL TO INTERANNUAL CLIMATE PREDICTION THROUGH THE DEVELOPMENT OF GLOBAL COUPLED PREDICTIVE MODELS.
doc.MajorAgency: MATERIAL TRANSPORT BY MESOSCALE EDDIES: ESTIMATES
doc.MajorFundingAgency: MATERIAL TRANSPORT BY MESOSCALE EDDIES: ESTIMATES

doc.ContractDescription: OBSERVING THE COOLING OF NEUTRON STARS REHEATED BY ACCRETION PROVIDES UNIQUE INSIGHTS INTO NEUTRON-STAR STRUCTURE. HERE WE PROPOSE TO CONTINUE OUR OBSERVATIONS OF THE COOLING NEUTRON STAR IN MAXIJ0556-332, A TRANSIENT THAT HAD BEEN ACCRETING AT NEAR/SUPER-EDDINGTON RATES FOR 16 MONTHS WHEN IT RETURNED TO QUIESCENCE IN MAY 2012. XMM- NEWTON AND CHANDRA OBSERVATIONS IN QUIESCENCE HAVE REVEALED A RAPIDLY COOLING NEUTRON STAR WITH BY FAR THE HIGHEST TEMPERATURES OBSERVED TO DATE FOR SUCH SYSTEMS. WE REQUEST AN 80 KS XMM-NEWTON OBSERVATION OF MAXIJ0556-332 TO INVESTIGATE IF THE CURRENT RAPID COOLING STARTS EVOLVING INTO A TEMPERATURE PLATEAU. KNOWING WHEN AND AT WHAT TEMPERATURE THIS OCCURS WILL HELP US IN UNDERSTANDING THE PROPERTIES OF THE NEUTRON-STAR CRUST, AS WE START PROBING ITS DEEPER LAYERS.

doc.ContractDescription: MERGERS AND INTERACTIONS HAVE PROFOUND EFFECTS ON THE EVOLUTION OF GALAXIES AND ON THE VARIOUS PHYSICAL PROCESSES ASSOCIATED WITH STAR FORMATION AND THE FUELING OF ACTIVE NUCLEI (AGN). THERE REMAINS, HOWEVER, AN INCOMPLETE UNDERSTANDING OF HOW INTERACTIONS AFFECT SUCH PROCESSES OR HOW IMPORTANT THEY ARE IN CONTROLLING THE APPEARANCE OF TODAY'S UNIVERSE. WE PROPOSE TO STUDY 180 INTERACTING GALAXIES IN 101 SYSTEMS SPANNING EARLY TO LATE STAGE MERGERS FOR WHICH NEWLY ARCHIVED NASA DATA ENABLE DETAILED ANALYSES OF THEIR ULTRAVIOLET-TO-FAR INFRARED (UV-FIR) SPECTRAL ENERGY DISTRIBUTIONS (SEDS). OUR GOAL IS AN IMPROVED UNDERSTANDING OF HOW A WIDE RANGE OF KEY GALAXY PARAMETERS VARY ACROSS THE INTERACTION SEQUENCE. OUR DERIVED PHYSICAL PARAMETERS WILL INCLUDE THE TOTAL OPTICALINFRARED LUMINOSITY, STAR FORMATION RATE, SPECIFIC STAR FORMATION RATE, STELLAR MASS, DUST TEMPERATURES AND DUST MASSES, COMPACTNESS, PHOTO-DISSOCIATION REGION (PDR) FRACTIONS, AND AGN CONTRIBUTIONS TO THE FIR SED. OUR SAMPLE IS TAKEN FROM THE KEEL-KENNICUTT CATALOG OF MERGING GALAXIES (BASED ONLY ON APPARENT GALAXY SEPARATIONS AND HENCE FREE OF MORPHOLOGICAL BIAS) AND THE SURACE IRAS SAMPLE OF BRIGHT MERGERS. OUR SAMPLE CONTAINS VIRTUALLY ALL BRIGHT MERGERS WITH UV-FIR DATA IN THE ARCHIVES, INCLUDING (BUT NOT LIMITED TO) DATA FROM MISSIONS GALEX, SWIFT, SPITZER, WISE, AND HERSCHEL. WE WILL RE-REDUCE, RECALIBRATE, AND EXTRACT THE PHOTOMETRY IN UP TO 23 WAVELENGTH BANDS FROM THE UV TO THE FIR. OUR ANALYSIS PLAN EMPHASIZES THREE NEW SED MODELING TOOLS, ONE OF WHICH WE HAVE RECENTLY DEVELOPED. NEARLY ALL OF THE SOURCES ALSO HAVE SPITZER IRS SPECTRAL DATA (PRIMARILY OF THE CIRCUMNUCLEAR REGIONS), AND WE WILL USE THE IRS DATA TO SUPPLEMENT THE SED CONCLUSIONS VIA OUR OWN ALGORITHM WHICH ALSO INFERS METALLICITY, INTERSTELLAR MEDIUM (ISM) AMBIENT PRESSURE, AND EMBEDDED YOUNG STAR FRACTIONS. FINALLY, WE WILL COMPARE EACH MERGER TO THE SIMULATED PHOTOMETRY/ MORPHOLOGY OF A SUITE OF SIMULATIONS BASED ON HERNQUIST ET AL. MODELS. SEDS FOR THE SIMULATIONS WILL BE CALCULATED IN EACH CASE USING THE SUNRISE RADIATIVE TRANSFER CODE. WE WILL IDENTIFY THE SIMULATION AND INTERACTING STAGE/AGE THAT BEST REPRODUCES EACH OBSERVED MERGER'S PROPERTIES. THE RESULTS WILL ALLOW US TO REFINE AND TEST HOW PHYSICAL PARAMETERS DEVELOP IN MERGERS OF VARIOUS KINDS, AS WELL AS HELP TEST THE RELIABILITY OF THE SIMULATION ASSUMPTIONS. WE WILL IN ADDITION ANALYZE 25 NON-INTERACTING GALAXIES AS COMPARISONS. WE HAVE ALREADY SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED THE ANALYSES SUITE ON A SUBSET OF 31 GALAXIES IN 14 MERGER GROUPS. THIS INITIAL SET CONTAINED ALL THE KEEL-KENNICUTT MERGERS FOR WHICH SUITABLE HERSCHEL DATA WERE IN THE ARCHIVE WHEN THE PROJECT BEGAN SEVERAL YEARS AGO. OUR CONCLUSIONS, PUBLISHED IN LANZ ET AL. (2013), DEMONSTRATE THE POWER OF THE TECHNIQUES TO TRACE PHYSICAL ACTIVITY ACROSS THE MERGER SEQUENCE. THE CONCLUSIONS, HOWEVER, WERE LIMITED BY THE SMALL NUMBERS. TODAY THE AVAILABLE DATASET IS MUCH LARGER AND, WITH THE END OF HERSCHEL, IS IN SOME SENSE COMPLETE. WE PROPOSE A FOCUSED EFFORT TO EXTEND OUR WORK TO THE LARGE SAMPLE DESCRIBED. THE MUCH LARGER SAMPLE WILL ENABLE US TO REACH MUCH FIRMER STATISTICAL CONCLUSIONS, AND TO ADDRESS THE PROCESSES IN INTERMEDIATE INTERACTION STAGES ACROSS A WIDER RANGE OF GALAXY MASS-RATIOS AND IMPACT PARAMETERS. OUR CATALOG OF ~23-BAND UV-FIR PHOTOMETRY ON THESE 180 (+25) GALAXIES WILL CONSTITUTE A LEGACY CONTRIBUTION. OUR CONCLUSIONS WILL HAVE APPLICATION FOR MERGERS IN THE MORE DISTANT UNIVERSE. OUR TEAM IS EXPERT IN THE IMPORTANT AND DIFFICULT ISSUES OF DATA REDUCTION AND ANALYSIS IN THE MANY BANDS REQUIRED FOR THIS PROJECT, IN MODELING AND USING BAYESIAN AND OTHER METHODS TO OBTAIN THE BEST FITS TO THE OBSERVATIONS FROM MULTI-COMPONENT GALAXY MODELS, IN THE SIMULATIONS, AND IN UNDERSTANDING PHYSICAL PROCESSES IN GALAXIES.
doc.MajorAgency: THE EVOLVING PHYSICAL PROCESSES IN INTERACTING GAL
doc.MajorFundingAgency: THE EVOLVING PHYSICAL PROCESSES IN INTERACTING GAL

doc.ContractDescription: IGF::CL::IGF EP-C-12-029 TO 64 PEER REVIEW OF EPA'S DRAFT PLANT AQUATIC LIFE CRITERIA (ALC) METHODOLOGY

INCLUDING MACROSCOPIC EFFECTS OF SMALL-SCALE E-REGION TURBULENCE IN GLOBAL MAGNETOSPHERE-IONOSPHERE-THERMOSPHERE MODELS THIS RESEARCH WILL IMPROVE GLOBAL MODELS OF THE MAGNETOSPHERE-IONOSPHERE-THERMOSPHERE (MIT) SYSTEM BY ADDING A CRUCIAL, YET UNIVERSALLY NEGLECTED, SOURCE OF IONOSPHERIC CONDUCTIVITY: THE EFFECTS OF IONOSPHERIC PLASMA TURBULENCE. CURRENT GLOBAL MIT MODELS ASSUME SIMPLE LAMINAR IONOSPHERIC FLOWS AND COMPLETELY DISREGARD THESE EFFECTS. RECENT GLOBAL SIMULATIONS HAVE SHOWN THAT CHANGES IN IONOSPHERIC CONDUCTIVITY CAN INFLUENCE THE GENERAL STRUCTURE OF THE MIT, CONTRIBUTE TO CROSS POLAR-CAP POTENTIAL SATURATION, MODIFY PLASMA SHEET AND IONOSPHERIC CONVECTION FLOWS, AND MAY MODIFY PARTICLE ENERGIZATION IN BOTH THE RADIATION BELTS AND THE AURORAL REGIONS. IN ORDER TO ACCURATELY MODEL SPACE WEATHER, RESEARCHERS REQUIRE PHYSICALLY ACCURATE CONDUCTIVITIES. DURING TIMES OF STRONG MAGNETOSPHERIC DISTURBANCES, LARGE-AMPLITUDE DC ELECTRIC FIELDS PENETRATE FROM THE EARTH'S MAGNETOSPHERE TO THE E-REGION IONOSPHERE WHERE THEY GENERATE SMALL-SCALE PLASMA DENSITY TURBULENCE. THIS TURBULENCE INDUCES NONLINEAR CURRENTS AND LEADS TO ANOMALOUS ELECTRON HEATING. RECENT THEORETICAL ANALYSES, ALONG WITH SUPERCOMPUTER PARTICLE-IN-CELL (PIC) SIMULATIONS, HAVE CLEARLY DEMONSTRATED THAT THESE ANOMALOUS EFFECTS CAN, AT LEAST, DOUBLE THE EFFECTIVE PEDERSEN CONDUCTANCE, A LEVEL OF CHANGE THAT WILL SUBSTANTIALLY MODIFY THE MIT SYSTEM. METHODOLOGY: THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL INCORPORATE THE MACROSCOPIC MANIFESTATIONS OF E-REGION SMALL-SCALE TURBULENCE INTO THE COUPLED MAGNETOSPHERE-IONOSPHERE-THERMOSPHERE (CMIT) MODEL. THIS PROJECT BRINGS TOGETHER EXPERTS IN KINETIC THEORY, PIC PLASMA SIMULATIONS, LARGE-SCALE SIMULATIONS OF THE IONOSPHERE-THERMOSPHERE, AND GLOBAL MHD MODELING OF THE MAGNETOSPHERE. THIS TASK WILL REQUIRE ADVANCES ON A NUMBER OF FRONTS: IMPROVING THE THEORETICAL DESCRIPTION OF LOCAL E-REGION TURBULENCE BY APPLYING MASSIVELY PARALLEL PIC PLASMA SIMULATIONS AND USING THE RESULTS TO BUILD RELATIVELY SIMPLE PARAMETERIZED MODELS OF IONOSPHERIC NON-LINEAR CONDUCTIVITIES FOR A RANGE OF CONDITIONS. THESE NEW CONDUCTIVITIES WILL THEN BE INCORPORATED INTO THE NCAR TIEGCM IONOSPHERETHERMOSPHERE MODEL. SINCE THE CMIT CODE COUPLES THE TIEGCM AND THE LFM GLOBAL MAGNETOSPHERE MODEL TOGETHER, THESE MODIFIED IONOSPHERIC PARAMETERS WILL AUTOMATICALLY TRANSFER INTO LFM. THIS IMPROVED VERSION OF THE CMIT MODEL WILL THEN BE USED TO EXPLORE THE BEHAVIOR OF THE COUPLED MIT SYSTEM DURING DISTURBED GEOPHYSICAL CONDITIONS AND THE RESULTS WILL BE CHECKED AGAINST IONOSPHERIC OBSERVATIONS. EXPECTED OUTCOME: THE RESULTS OF THE PROJECT WILL ANSWER THE PRIMARY QUESTION: HOW DOES AN IMPROVED SPECIFICATION OF IONOSPHERIC CONDUCTIVITY CHANGE THE SIMULATED STORM-TIME STRUCTURE AND EVOLUTION OF THE MIT SYSTEM? SPECIFICALLY, THIS RESEARCH WILL EVALUATE THE FOLLOWING: (1) HOW DO STRONG MAGNETOSPHERIC PERTURBATIONS MODIFY IONOSPHERIC CONDUCTIVITY? (2) HOW DOES GLOBAL SCALE MAGNETOSPHERIC CONVECTION AND THE OVERALL STRUCTURE OF THE MAGNETOSPHERE DEPEND ON IONOSPHERIC CONDUCTANCE MODELS? (3) WHAT ROLE DOES ENHANCED IONOSPHERIC CONDUCTIVITY PLAY IN CROSS-POLAR CAP POTENTIAL SATURATION? (4) WHAT EFFECTS DO STRONG CONVECTION ELECTRIC FIELDS HAVE ON THE CHEMICAL AND IONIZATION-RECOMBINATION BALANCES IN THE IONOSPHERE-THERMOSPHERE SYSTEM AND HOW DOES THAT DEPEND UPON CONDUCTANCE MODELS. THIS RESEARCH WILL HELP NASA MEET ITS SCIENCE AREA OBJECTIVES FOR HELIOPHYSICS. SPECIFICALLY, BY IMPROVING THE SCIENTIFIC COMMUNITY'S ABILITY TO SIMULATE THE GLOBAL RESPONSE OF THE MIT TO CHANGES IN THE GEOSPACE ENVIRONMENT, THIS RESEARCH WILL IMPROVE OUR ABILITY TO UNDERSTAND THE FUNDAMENTAL PHYSICAL PROCESSES OF THE SPACE ENVIRONMENT FROM THE SUN TO EARTH (OBJECTIVE 1). THIS WILL HELP NASA MEET OBJECTIVES 2 AND 3 AS WELL BY IMPROVING OUR GEOSPACE PREDICTIVE CAPABILITIES FOR INTENSE EVENTS.

doc.ContractDescription: PSEUDO LINEAR HALL THRUSTER
IGF::OT::IGF MOD TO CORRECT WAWF CLAUSE

WE PROPOSE TO DESIGN AND BUILD THE FIRST IMAGING HARD X-RAY DETECTOR SYSTEM THAT INCORPORATES 3D STACKING OF CLOSELY PACKED DETECTOR READOUTS IN FINELY-SPACED IMAGING ARRAYS WITH THEIR REQUIRED DATA PROCESSING AND CONTROL ELECTRONICS. IN VIRTUALLY ALL IMAGING ASTRONOMICAL DETECTORS, DETECTOR READOUT IS DONE WITH "FLEX CONNECTORS" OR CONNECTIONS THAT ARE NOT "VERTICAL" BUT RATHER "HORIZONTAL", REQUIRING LOSS OF FOCAL PLANE AREA. FOR HIGH RESOLUTION PIXEL DETECTORS NEEDED FOR HIGH SPEED EVENT-BASED X-RAY IMAGING, FROM LOW ENERGY APPLICATIONS (CMOS) WITH FOCUSING X-RAY TELESCOPES, TO HARD X-RAY APPLICATIONS WITH PIXELATED CZT FOR LARGE AREA CODED APERTURE TELESCOPES, THIS NEW DETECTOR DEVELOPMENT OFFERS GREAT PROMISE. WE PROPOSE TO EXTEND OUR PREVIOUS AND CURRENT APRASUPPORTED PROTOEXIST PROGRAM THAT HAS DEVELOPED THE FIRST LARGE AREA IMAGING CZT DETECTORS AND DEMONSTRATED THEIR ASTROPHYSICAL CAPABILITIES ON TWO SUCCESSFUL BALLOON FLIGHT TO A NEXT GENERATION HIGH RESOLUTION ENERGETIC X-RAY IMAGER (HREXI), WHICH WOULD INCORPORATE MICROVIA TECHNOLOGY FOR THE FIRST TIME TO CONNECT THE READOUT ASIC ON EACH CZT CRYSTAL DIRECTLY TO ITS CONTROL AND DATA PROCESSING SYSTEM. THIS 3-DIMENSIONAL STACKING OF DETECTOR AND READOUT/CONTROL SYSTEM MEANS THAT LARGE AREA (>2M2) IMAGING DETECTOR PLANES FOR A HIGH RESOLUTION WIDE-FIELD HARD X-RAY TELESCOPE CAN BE BUILT WITH INITIALLY GREATLY REDUCED DETECTOR GAPS AND ULTIMATELY WITH NO GAPS. THIS INCREASES DETECTOR AREA, EFFICIENCY, AND SIMPLICITY OF DETECTOR INTEGRATION. THUS HIGHER SENSITIVITY WIDE-FIELD IMAGERS WILL BE POSSIBLE AT LOWER COST.
